quizzes.textContent: [h1]Changing Attributes[/h1] Once you have selected the element(s) you want to work with, you can change their attributes. As we have seen in the previous lessons, we can change the text content of an element using the [b]innerHTML [/b]property. Similarly, we can change the attributes of elements. For example, we can change the [b]src [/b]attribute of an image: [code format="html" ] [/code] We can change the [b]href [/b]attribute of a link: [code format="html" codeId="956"]Some link [/code] [note]Practically all attributes of an element can be changed using JavaScript. [/note]

[h1]Changing Style[/h1] The style of HTML elements can also be changed using JavaScript. All style attributes can be accessed using the [b]style [/b]object of the element. [b]For example:[/b][code format="html" codeId="957"]
some text
[/code] The code above changes the text [b]color [/b]and [b]width [/b]of the div element. [note]All CSS properties can be set and modified using JavaScript. Just remember, that you cannot use dashes (-) in the property names: these are replaced with camelCase versions, where the compound words begin with a capital letter. For example: the [b]background-color[/b] property should be referred to as [b]backgroundColor[/b].[/note]
